channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Coiled Tight: Smaller Companies Are Primed for Outperformance
item.description: Small-cap companies are poised for a rebound. The sector is best approached through an active investment strategy where expertise and a deep understanding of the individual businesses and their risk-and-reward characteristics are necessary for success.

item.title: Google employees grill Sundar Pichai and CFO Ruth Porat on why they're not getting pay rises amid blowout earnings
item.description: “Despite the company’s stellar performance and record earnings, many Googlers have not received meaningful compensation increases,” one top-rated question began.

item.title: Investment Returns Are NOT Random
item.description: Are investment returns random across time as Burton Malkiel suggests in his book, A Random Walk Down Wall Street? There is notable disagreement on this topic. This research finds that practitioners may need to rethink their portfolio optimization routines.

item.title: AstraZeneca pulls its COVID-19 vaccine from European market after history of stumbles
item.description: Partial results from its first major trial — which Britain used to authorize the vaccine — were clouded by a manufacturing mistake that researchers didn’t immediately acknowledge.

item.title: Generational Wealth: Does the Apple Fall Far From the Tree?
item.description: There is strong evidence that most “rich families” will be poorer after several generations. Some of the reasons for this are systemic like taxes. But most factors that diminish a family’s wealth over generations are the choices that heirs make.

item.title: Norwegian wealth fund CEO converts a century-old grain silo into a $46 million art display to promote tourism in his hometown
item.description: Once home to 15,000 tons of grain, Norges Bank CEO Nicolai Tangen's Kunstsilo is now a gallery of more than 5,000 artworks.

item.title: State Capitalism in Private Markets: Mission Creep
item.description: Governments relish mingling in markets. Yet, if past policies are any guide, taxpayers are being shortchanged.

item.title: I'm a founder struggling with mental-health issues. How can I step away from my startup?
item.description: Bonobos and Pie founder Andy Dunn answers questions about how a founder can address mental health challenges, and how fast is too fast to grow.

item.title: Implementation Shortfalls Hamstring Factor Strategies
item.description: Smart rebalancing rules help portfolio managers capture more of the return that is inherent in their factor strategies. Concentrating on “priority best” trading improves factor portfolio performance.

item.title: New York City’s watchdog investigates whether NYPD used official social media accounts to target public officials and private citizens
item.description: The Department of Investigation confirmed the probe, saying it was prompted by recent requests from City Council Speaker Adrienne Adams and the Legal Aid Society.
